poem:
Title: Grains of Salt

White gowns in the South,
angry amid the sterile halls -
robbed of voice and vigor.
The North plucks stars from their sky,
smiles with borrowed light.
Absence echoes in empty wards,
the world turns again, its hunger insatiable. 
A battle of cycles,
fullness and void,
the healers we need,
the healers we steal.
A rhythm unbroken,
in sorrow, unveiled.
